intro: Myodocarpus vieillardii var. longipes, commonly known as the long-peduncled myodocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when ripe, attracting various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
